overview: This subject considers a range of fundamental skills and issues pertinent to practising psychologists. Topics include counselling and interviewing techniques, history taking and diagnosis, conducting a mental state examination, developing a client formulation, as well as the importance of self-care. The subject will include opportunities for students to practise newly acquired skills through role-plays and simulated client interactions during the teaching sessions which are primarily full-day workshops.

Students will also complete the Ways of Knowing program.  This interprofessional curriculum activity brings together students from a range of disciplines to engage with multiple knowledges and ways of knowing.  This will be achieved through completion of four nested activities where students will have the opportunity to learn from, with and about students from other disciplines exploring Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health and wellbeing, cultural safety and collaborative practice.  The learning activities will require students to critically reflect upon their own knowledges of health, biases and assumptions and aims to develop essential behaviours, values and attitudes required for collaborative and cultural safety practice.

assessments.description: Written reflection on cultural walk component of Ways of Knowing program. 250 words. Hurdle requirement:. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.

Written reflection on interprofessional learning and culturally safe practices following the interdisciplinary panel discussion component of Ways of Knowing program. 1000 words. Hurdle requirement:. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.
Written report - self-reflection on self-care needs. 500 words

Oral presentation - demonstration of basic interview techniques, including Mental State Examination. 20 minutes. Hurdle requirement:. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.

Written report - diagnostic work up of case study. 1200 words. Hurdle requirement:. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.

Year Long.Contact hours:
52.5 hours. Attendance at six 7-hour and one 3-hour workshop
On campus attendance at all components of Ways of Knowing program (Cultural Walk- approx. 90 minutes; Completion of Cultural Safety Essential E-Modules- 3 hours; Attendance at online Interprofessional Tutorial Group- 2 hours and attendance at Panel webinar – 1 hour
Workshops and Ways of Knowing program are predominately scheduled for first half of the year as content covered is fundamental to the remainder of the training programs therefore needs to be taught early in programs

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
